nodes.bodyText: This file is missing a licence header, and I'm actually not sure what should we put here, since parts of the code were copied from OpenCensus IIUC?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,68 @@
+package io.opentelemetry.opencensusshim;

nodes.bodyText:
We have this pattern for including two licenses, yeah in any file with copies let's use it
https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-java/blob/master/context/src/main/java/io/opentelemetry/context/Context.java#L6
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,68 @@
+package io.opentelemetry.opencensusshim;

nodes.bodyText: nit: Do we even need to perform these checks if the implementation is a no-op?
This seems like less of a nit, and more of a problem. If it throws exceptions on bad inputs, it's not a no-op, I think.

I actually just copied all of this from https://github.com/census-instrumentation/opencensus-java/blob/f0e78ba5a10165cce2b63809bfdfe3e34b1eb456/impl_core/src/main/java/io/opencensus/implcore/trace/NoRecordEventsSpanImpl.java
Not sure why there are checks in the OC implementation, happy to remove the checks here though if it makes more sense
If OC users are fine with that behavior, then it's cool. We've taken a different approach in OTel, but this is fine if it's what users are used to.
Why protected?
this has been deleted

Context Interaction:

a wrapped.Span is added to the OC context, we add the "wrapped span" to the Otel Context
a blank oc Span is added to the OC context, we add a "blank span" to the Otel Context
a otel.Span is added to the Otel Context, we create a wrapper and add it to OC Context.
@bogdandrutu yep I've updated everything now, could you please take another look?
I am not sure this is what I meant. I was trying to suggest to use composition when implementing the OC required types and delegate everything to otel.

I'm quite confused. I'm delegating everything to oTel after creating the oTel span here: https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-java/pull/2060/files#diff-4b913d64466c48a3f3149a7e7c9345886e02931d69396c8223fc855818f3e261R166-R167
Could you explain what you were expecting a bit more?

I've moved some of the logic from startSpan() to the methods overriding OC methods, such as addParentLinks() and setSpanKind() to set Otel fields directly. The rest depend on the sampler, which does all of https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-java/pull/2060/files#diff-4b913d64466c48a3f3149a7e7c9345886e02931d69396c8223fc855818f3e261R109-R146 to determine the kind of span that should be created. Since the sampler takes in OC parameters (parent, hasRemoteParent, traceId, spanId, name, parentLinks), I don't think I can map and delegate this nor its parameters to Otel, especially since the sampler could be implemented by the user.

@bogdandrutu If I'm not mistaken, we can't eagerly delegate to OTel because it doesn't have setRecordEvents or setSampler. Having setSampler on OTel's SpanBuilder seems useful to me but guess it's a spec change. setRecordEvents we shouldn't need since pretty sure that can just be implemented as setSampler(ALWAYS_OFF). If we could do it, then all the logic in this class goes away I think (would need mapSampler to shim the sampler)
I see, maybe we can stick with what we have here for the moment, and look into ways to improve this.
Also I think this should be OpenTelemetryTextFormat and it can have a constructor to accept any TextMapPropagator instead of being hardcoded to b3.

Add a comment something like OpenCensus's code for BinaryFormat is in the implementation, not API. Since we don't want to depend on the implementation for shim users, we reimplement it here.
Also, let's just copy https://github.com/census-instrumentation/opencensus-java/blob/0a2f5799a2809b84e4c0da4b2cb743b798ca0fc8/impl_core/src/main/java/io/opencensus/implcore/trace/propagation/BinaryFormatImpl.java 100% - there seems to be no benefit in mapping into the OTel types here

This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            public class OpenTelemetryNoRecordEventsSpanImpl extends Span
          
          
            
            class OpenTelemetryNoRecordEventsSpanImpl extends Span
Let's go ahead and put the constructor above the methods
return this instead of return null throughout
Shouldn't it be the mapped context, not invalid? Is SpanContext guaranteed to be invalid in the constructor? I'm guessing no since in that case we wouldn't even need a constructor parameter for it.
I think we need to prefix almost every variable in this file with either oc or otel, quite hard to read right now
Or at least otel for all otel (e.g., OTEL_TRACER)
I think

I think the null is necessary here since the sampler's comment says

@param hasRemoteParent {@code true} if the parent {@code Span} is remote. {@code null} if this is a root span.
Think you an use mapSpanContext

I think only OpenCensus instrumentation will interact with these spans, unless for some reason a user decided to get an OC parent/child span from a library and change its status. I've updated the Otel methods to delegate to the otelSpan just in case though.
Per my above comment, you should be able to have just one class for both b3 and w3c
Do we still need FakeSpan? Can't we use one of the new Span implementations where this is being used?
Let's use fullly qualified class names, it's really tricky knowing which Kind is which
An OTel kind should never be null - INTERNAL?
Should we map this trace state?
By making a generic OpenTelemetryTextFormat we won't need all this testing, we'd be able to test a mock TextMapPropagator
Oh wait - this is the binary format test XD. Rename the class. I guess we need tests for the textmappropagator wrapper too.
Not using any junit4 features here, can you switch to jupiter?
Do you think we need to support the OC clock? I'd recommend removing this line if it seems reasonable.

The clock is created at https://github.com/zoercai/opentelemetry-java/blob/4e7d8b25cb24466f5a678cfd67dd5769fe599d4e/opencensus-shim/src/main/java/io/opentelemetry/opencensusshim/OpenTelemetryTraceComponentImpl.java#L33
and is publicly available via Tracing.java, so it seems like I should use it here just in case. Let me know if you think it's unnecessary though!

Customizing the OC clock seems like a very small use case - it seems unlikely to do any better than what OTel will provide (e.g., we updated the Clock in OTel to use Java 9+ for improved precision) so it could be considered a good thing to not respect the OC clock. But no personal opinion food for thought on what could be better here.
I've removed the clock
Looks like you can extract a helper for converting oc attributes to otel attributes
Can remove public from test methods
Can remove public from all the methods
